text: you're looking for a simple super
seasonal fall
pasta look no further today I'm making a
creamy pumpkin pasta using canned
pumpkin start off by cooking your pasta
12 ounces of a short pasta make sure
your pasta water is nice and salty then
you want to cook some rosemary this is a
kind of unique flavoring but it goes
really really well with the pumpkin so
I'm going to fry some rosemary needles
first and then we can stir them in at
the end so heat 2 tablespoons of olive
oil in a large skillet the skillet is
extra large because I'm going to toss
the pasta in here later like I often do
in my recipes and then to that add about
2 tablespoons of fresh rosemary needles
great part is how they flavor the oil
and then the whole pasta sauce gets
really nice flavoring these rosemary
needles should sizzle and crisp up
really nicely and it shouldn't take very
long at all
and then as they seem to be getting done
if they're getting brown just remove
them I like to use tongs to just lift
them out of the oil and that'll leave
the flavored oil in the pan then drain
your rosemary needles on some paper
towels
don't let your pan get too hot because
now what you're gonna do is cook the
rest of your sauce it's 1 can of pumpkin
now be careful in fact I'm going to turn
this way down because it's gonna
splatter a little bit because the
moisture and the pumpkin and the oil so
you see forewarn you see it happen it'll
stop pretty quickly
this is a job for an up apron not a down
apron the way that I'm wearing it
turn it around till it stops flattering
which should happen pretty quickly and
add a quarter teaspoon of red pepper
flakes one small clove of minced garlic
I like to do that right into the oil so
just gets a little bit of frying action
happening stir stir stir stir stir once
it stops fluttering you can turn the
heat back up and then you can add 1/2 a
cup of half-and-half stir everything
together and then add a third of a cup
of grated Parmesan cheese see this is a
very creamy mixture mommy
guys creamy pumpkin pasta what Oh salt
and pepper
don't forget that otherwise the balance
will be way off this seems like it's
heated through so I'm gonna just turn it
off and wait for my pasta to finish and
then toss everything together right here
in this pan don't forget to save some
pasta water 1/2 a cups probably good
enough and then drain mm-hmm I can't see
anything going on and my glasses are all
fogged up add the pasta directly to the
pan with your sauce and then toss
together it does look a little bit
clumpy I guess is the right word so I'm
gonna add some of that pasta water and
you can turn the heat back on I like to
do that just to get everything really
combined absorbs the pasta water it
makes a nice silky sauce and that's your
dinner tonight if you would like to make
your own pumpkin puree by all means go
ahead we have some great recipes for
making it on the website but the canned
versions are so great and so easy to get
keep them in your cabinet this is a
pantry dinner if you do that which I
absolutely love I'm constantly going
into my pantry staring in there for 15
minutes being like what am I gonna make
and if I had this pumpkin I could make
this put some of those little rosemary
fried Krispies on top a little bit of
extra cheese never hurt anybody and
you're good to go
dinner straight from the pantry for me
to you honey you can do that with
pumpkin
